<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[891, 221, 919, 238]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[623, 220, 722, 248]]<|/det|> <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[39, 263, 80, 281]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[89, 279, 348, 294]]<|/det|> ADDITIONAL MATHEMATICS <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[826, 279, 907, 294]]<|/det|> 0606/12 <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 302, 269, 317]]<|/det|> Paper 1 Non-calculator <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[783, 304, 907, 319]]<|/det|> May/June 2025 <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[858, 328, 907, 342]]<|/det|> 2 hours <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 357, 396, 372]]<|/det|> You must answer on the question paper. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 386, 361, 401]]<|/det|> No additional materials are needed. <|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[91, 419, 225, 432]]<|/det|> INSTRUCTIONS <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 291, 450]]<|/det|> - Answer all questions. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 451, 761, 466]]<|/det|> - Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 466, 808, 481]]<|/det|> - Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 481, 565, 497]]<|/det|> - Write your answer to each question in the space provided. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 497, 482, 512]]<|/det|> - Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 513, 361, 528]]<|/det|> - Do not write on any bar codes. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 528, 451, 544]]<|/det|> - Calculators must not be used in this paper. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 544, 468, 559]]<|/det|> - You must show all necessary working clearly. <|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[91, 589, 214, 602]]<|/det|> INFORMATION <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 605, 388, 620]]<|/det|> - The total mark for this paper is 80. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 620, 730, 635]]<|/det|> - The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[430, 74, 567, 91]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[601, 102, 783, 124]]<|/det|>
\[
(x-a)^{2}+(y-b)^{2}=r^{2}
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 105, 477, 124]]<|/det|>
Equation of a circle with centre \((a, b)\) and radius \(r\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[603, 157, 672, 173]]<|/det|>
\(A=\pi r l\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 157, 537, 174]]<|/det|>
Curved surface area, \(A\), of cone of radius \(r\), sloping edge \(l\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 203, 374, 220]]<|/det|>
Surface area, \(A\), of sphere of radius \(r\).

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[604, 199, 686, 218]]<|/det|>
\[
A=4 \pi r^{2}
\]

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[603, 244, 682, 274]]<|/det|>
\[
V=\frac{1}{3} A h
\]

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[604, 290, 686, 321]]<|/det|>
\[
V=\frac{4}{3} \pi r^{3}
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 206, 374, 221]]<|/det|>
Volume, \(V\), of pyramid or cone, base area \(A\), height \(h\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 298, 338, 315]]<|/det|>
Volume, \(V\), of sphere of radius \(r\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 347, 236, 364]]<|/det|>
Quadratic equation

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 445, 225, 460]]<|/det|>
Binomial theorem

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 552, 220, 568]]<|/det|>
Arithmetic series

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[391, 459, 908, 524]]<|/det|>
\[
\begin{array}{r}
(a+b)^{n}=a^{n}+\binom{n}{1} a^{n-1} b+\binom{n}{2} a^{n-2} b^{2}+\cdots+\binom{n}{r} a^{n-r} b^{r}+\ldots+b^{n}, \\
\text { where } n \text { is a positive integer and } \binom{n}{r}=\frac{n !}{(n-r) ! r !}
\end{array}
\]

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[391, 552, 669, 595]]<|/det|>
\[
\begin{aligned}
& u_{n}=a+(n-1) d \\
& S_{n}=\frac{1}{2} n(a+l)=\frac{1}{2} n\{2 a+(n-1) d\}
\end{aligned}
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 630, 220, 647]]<|/det|>
Geometric series

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[391, 628, 573, 710]]<|/det|>
\[
\begin{aligned}
& u_{n}=a r^{n-1} \\
& S_{n}=\frac{a(1-r^{n})}{1-r} \quad(r \neq 1) \\
& S_{\infty}=\frac{a}{1-r} \quad(|r|<1)
\end{aligned}
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 739, 160, 754]]<|/det|>
Identities

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[391, 736, 556, 788]]<|/det|>
\[
\begin{aligned}
& \sin ^{2} A+\cos ^{2} A=1 \\
& \sec ^{2} A=1+\tan ^{2} A \\
& \operatorname{cosec}^{2} A=1+\cot ^{2} A
\end{aligned}
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 829, 240, 844]]<|/det|>
Formulas for \(\Delta A B C\)

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[391, 823, 579, 900]]<|/det|>
\[
\begin{aligned}
& \frac{a}{\sin A}=\frac{b}{\sin B}=\frac{c}{\sin C} \\
& a^{2}=b^{2}+c^{2}-2 b c \cos A \\
& \Delta=\frac{1}{2} a b \sin C
\end{aligned}
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 102, 94, 119]]<|/det|>
1

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[146, 123, 852, 318]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 349, 697, 368]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the graph of \(y=|\mathrm{f}(x)|\), where f is a cubic polynomial. Find expressions for the two possible functions \(\mathrm{f}(x)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 382, 482, 399]]<|/det|>
Write each expression in fully factorised form.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 76, 648, 95]]<|/det|>
3 A circle with centre \(C\) has the equation \(x^{2}+y^{2}-10 x-4 y+24=0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 109, 603, 126]]<|/det|>
(a) Show that the line \(y=2 x-3\) is a tangent to this circle.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 310, 791, 327]]<|/det|>
(b) Given that this tangent touches the circle at the point \(P\), find the coordinates of \(P\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 449, 822, 466]]<|/det|>
(c) Find the equation of the circle which has its centre at \(P\) and passes through the origin.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 76, 303, 108]]<|/det|>
4 (a) Find \(\int_{0}^{\pi} \sin \theta \mathrm{d} \theta\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 295, 727, 321]]<|/det|>
(b) Given that \(0<\alpha<\frac{\pi}{2}\), show that \(\frac{\sec \alpha}{\cot \alpha+\tan \alpha}\) can be written as \(\sin \alpha\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 76, 796, 96]]<|/det|>
5 The polynomial p is such that \(\mathrm{p}(x)=3 x^{3}-7 x^{2}+a x+b\), where \(a\) and \(b\) are integers.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 109, 603, 126]]<|/det|>
It is given that \(\mathrm{p}^{\prime}(-1)=21\) and that \(x-2\) is a factor of \(\mathrm{p}(x)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 140, 366, 157]]<|/det|>
(a) Find the values of \(a\) and \(b\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 418, 719, 434]]<|/det|>
(b) Hence write \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) as a product of linear factors with integer coefficients.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 583, 754, 604]]<|/det|>
(c) Using your values of \(a\) and \(b\), solve the equation \(3 \mathrm{e}^{6 y}-7 \mathrm{e}^{4 y}+a \mathrm{e}^{2 y}+b=0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 76, 918, 96]]<|/det|>
6 When \(\ln y\) is plotted against \(x^{3}\) ，a straight line passing through the points \((2,5)\) and \((-8,25)\) is obtained．

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 109, 316, 126]]<|/det|>
（a）Find \(y\) in terms of \(x\) ．

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 400, 421, 420]]<|/det|>
（b）Find the value of \(x\) when \(y=\mathrm{e}^{25}\) ．

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 76, 882, 108]]<|/det|>
7 A geometric progression has a 4th term of \(\frac{8 k^{6}}{27}\) and a 6th term of \(\frac{32 k^{10}}{243}\), where \(k\) is a constant.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 117, 584, 134]]<|/det|>
The common ratio of this geometric progression is positive.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 148, 918, 165]]<|/det|>
(a) Find the common ratio in terms of \(k\) and the value of the first term of this geometric progression.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 517, 881, 535]]<|/det|>
(b) Given that this geometric progression has a sum to infinity of 3 , find the possible values of \(k\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 76, 388, 110]]<|/det|>
8 It is given that \(y=\frac{\ln \left(3 x^{2}+16\right)}{x+2}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 109, 327, 142]]<|/det|>
(a) Find \(\frac{\mathrm{d} y}{\mathrm{~d} x}\) when \(x=0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 150, 601, 167]]<|/det|>
Give your answer in the form \(\ln p\), where \(p\) is a constant.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 534, 882, 552]]<|/det|>
(b) Given that \(x\) increases from 0 to \(h\), where \(h\) is small, write down the approximate change in \(y\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 76, 645, 95]]<|/det|>
9 It is given that \(\mathrm{f}(x)=2 \ln (3 x-4)\), for \(x>a\), and that \(\mathrm{f}^{-1}\) exists.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 109, 421, 126]]<|/det|>
(a) Find the least possible value of \(a\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 187, 465, 204]]<|/det|>
(b) For your value of \(a\), find the range of f .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 275, 550, 298]]<|/det|>
(c) For your value of \(a\), find an expression for \(\mathrm{f}^{-1}(x)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 384, 595, 404]]<|/det|>
(d) It is given that the equation \(\mathrm{f}(x)=\mathrm{f}^{-1}(x)\) has two roots.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 415, 770, 436]]<|/det|>
For your value of \(a\), sketch the graphs of \(y=\mathrm{f}(x)\) and \(y=\mathrm{f}^{-1}(x)\) on the axes.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 449, 300, 466]]<|/det|>
Label each graph. State the intercepts of each graph with the axes.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 480, 457, 497]]<|/det|>
State the equations of any asymptotes.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[145, 511, 853, 791]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 71, 105, 88]]<|/det|>
10

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[321, 86, 678, 255]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 275, 449, 291]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the shape \(O A B C D E F\). \(A O F\) is a straight line.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 306, 616, 321]]<|/det|>
\(O A B\) and \(O E F\) are sectors of a circle with centre \(O\) and radius \(r\). Angle \(B O A=\) angle \(E O F\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 345, 555, 374]]<|/det|>
\(O C D\) is a sector of a circle with centre \(O\) and radius \(\frac{4 r}{3}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 382, 316, 399]]<|/det|>
Angle \(C O D\) is \(\theta\) radians. The point \(B\) lies on the line \(O C\) and the point \(E\) lies on the line \(O D\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 413, 424, 430]]<|/det|>
The line \(B E\) is parallel to the line \(A O F\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 445, 645, 462]]<|/det|>
(a) Find, in terms of \(r\) and \(\theta\), the area of the shaded region \(B C D E\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 74, 146, 91]]<|/det|>
(b)

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[320, 86, 678, 254]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 275, 716, 290]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the shape from part (a) with region \(O A B E F\) shaded. Find, in terms of \(r\) and \(\theta\), the perimeter of the shaded region.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 71, 105, 89]]<|/det|>
11

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[146, 87, 853, 298]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 314, 667, 334]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the triangle \(O A B\), where \(\overrightarrow{O A}=\mathbf{a}\) and \(\overrightarrow{O B}=\mathbf{b}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 341, 487, 370]]<|/det|>
The point \(P\) lies on \(O A\) such that \(\quad \overrightarrow{O P}=\frac{3}{4} \overrightarrow{O A}\). The point \(Q\) lies on \(A B\) such that \(\quad \overrightarrow{A Q}=\frac{1}{3} \overrightarrow{A B}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 410, 802, 426]]<|/det|>
The straight line through \(P\) and \(Q\) meets the straight line through \(O\) and \(B\) at the point \(R\). It is given that \(\overrightarrow{O R}=\lambda \mathbf{b}\) and \(\overrightarrow{P R}=\mu \overrightarrow{P Q}\), where \(\lambda\) and \(\mu\) are constants.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 470, 413, 491]]<|/det|>
(a) Find \(\overrightarrow{O R}\) in terms of \(\mathbf{a}, \mathbf{b}\) and \(\mu\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 76, 427, 93]]<|/det|>
(b) Hence find the values of \(\lambda\) and \(\mu\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 76, 680, 99]]<|/det|>
12 A curve is such that its gradient at the point \((x, y)\) is given by \((5 x-2)^{\frac{1}{3}}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 105, 463, 134]]<|/det|>
The curve passes through the point \(\left(2, \frac{32}{5}\right)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 143, 559, 159]]<|/det|>
Find the coordinates of the stationary point on the curve.
